intro: Zaluzania nonensis, commonly known as the Florida zayre, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with purple centers. Zaluzania nonensis plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland biodiversity.
